isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Service (1991) - INJECTION PUMP, NOZZLES, FUEL FILTER, SUPPLY PUMP AND GLOW PLUGS - FUEL INJECTION NOZZLES - CARE OF LAPPING BLOCKS

svcprocinfo.para: It will be necessary to perform a certain amount of maintenance on the lapping blocks to keep them in top condition. The wear will be gradual but, by continued use, worn or low spots in the block must be removed.
A short time spent each day in hand-lapping the blocks will be an effective way of maintaining the finish necessary for quality lapping.

svcsubproc.title: Reconditioning the Lapping Blocks
svcsubproc.para: The lapping blocks must be thoroughly cleaned before any reconditioning is started. Use a stiff bristle brush (not a wire brush) and scrub the blocks in a good solvent and blow dry with filtered compressed air.
All lapping blocks in a set are involved in the reconditioning procedure outlined below:

step1.para: Spread a small amount of 1000 grit lapping compound (prepared in a paste) on block number 1, assuming the blocks to be numbered 1, 2 and 3.

Lap number 1 and 2 (face to face) together, using the figure eight pattern ( Figure 9.53
). Then take 1 and 3; and finally 2 and 3.

svcsubproc.para: After working 1 and 3 together, wipe off number 2 on a clean sheet of paper placed on a flat surface. Low spots, if any, will appear as dark spots and high spots as bright spots. Continue the lapping procedure until the overall appearance is a uniform grey surface.

step1.para: After the blocks have been refinished, clean them thoroughly in a good solvent using a bristle brush, then blow dry with filtered compressed air.
